LKZSB?9:~5*(mlfl4-rw: This liquid is part of the pour if several things are true: it's the right color, it's in the source tube and at its top, and the target isn't full

NhZmIP9E-P~M=?SGa6D8: Abort if a pour is already in progress.
I initially tried to allow multiple pours at the same time, but since broadcasts interrupt other broadcasts, it opened the door to weird bugs and animation errors.

nfl=]~%5WBFB_4F0p[RZ: If tube count is > 5, split into 2 rows
This is the algorithm to space them evently. It's not pretty, but it works
Which character in the level string represents the start of this tube
It's a character INDEX -- so it's a number of letters into the string. For example, the index of "o" in "hello" is 5
Compare the 2-4th colors to the 1st. If they all match, the tube is complete!
"Setup tubes" is also used when adding a new tube, so we reset "tube contents" here
